meanings.definition: Belonging exclusively or confined to a particular place
meanings.sent1: The endemical flowers in the garden only grow here.
meanings.sent2: The endemical species of bird is found only in this forest.
meanings.sent3: It seems the endemical squirrel has claimed this tree as its own.
meanings.sent4: The endemical culture of the island is truly unique.
meanings.sent5: The endemical smell of the bakery always reminds me of home.

meanings.definition: Native or restricted to a certain region
meanings.sent1: The endemical language spoken here is not understood elsewhere.
meanings.sent2: The endemical fish in the lake are not found in other waters.
meanings.sent3: The endemical fashion sense of the town is quite interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her endemical knowledge of the forest made her an expert guide.
meanings.sent5: The endemical music of the region is full of traditional instruments.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a particular area or environment
meanings.sent1: The endemical weather patterns here are quite predictable.
meanings.sent2: The endemical architecture of the city reflects its history.
meanings.sent3: The endemical taste of the local dish surprised the tourists.
meanings.sent4: His endemical style of painting captures the essence of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The endemical wildlife of the park is protected by law.
